DataElement.preferredName: Image Table Feed Per Rotation Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The distance in mm that the table moves in one second during the gathering of data that resulted in this frame.  For CT: Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL or CONSTANT_ANGLE. May be present otherwise if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL or CONSTANT_ANGLE.  [Standard-based]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Motion of the table (in mm) during a complete revolution of the source around the gantry orbit.     For CT:  The distance in mm that the table moves in one second during the gathering of data that resulted in this frame. Required if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is ORIGINAL and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL or CONSTANT_ANGLE. May be present otherwise if Frame Type (0008,9007) Value 1 of this frame is DERIVED and Acquisition Type (0018,9302) is SPIRAL or CONSTANT_ANGLE.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: A piece of furniture having a smooth flat top that is usually supported by one or more vertical legs or any object of a similar appearance.:To move something gradually into or through.:No Value Exists:A single complete turn (axial or orbital).

Concepts.definition: A piece of furniture having a smooth flat top that is usually supported by one or more vertical legs or any object of a similar appearance.
To move something gradually into or through.
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
A single complete turn (axial or orbital).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  9/11/07  CDE created to support DICOM CDE IE & DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A single complete turn (axial or orbital) measured in millimeters during a completion revolution of the source around an orbit. [Manually-curated]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A single complete turn (axial or orbital).:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A single complete turn (axial or orbital).
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  9/11/07  VD versioned to support DICOM task utilizing IE & DICOM Attribute terms; VD set to 8 byte to match DICOM FD VD type.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  9/11/07-Reited for IE/Attr format CDE; reused VD in new CDE.  10/26/06-updated for DICOM PS 3 - 2006.  CDE supports DICOM Standard PS 3 - 2004.
